ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class NavigationWithCorr

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.NavigationWithCorr
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class NavigationWithCorr
extends java.lang.Thread

    This class implements the simple navigator. Some of the existing motor instances and a few constants not dependent on navigation. This class extends the Thread class to allow simultaneous execution, so that other classes can work alongside this class. Helper methods are added at the end to make conversions easier.

    The robot completes a path with a total of 5 points, specified using a coordinate system relative to the start of the robot. The robot is (0,0), with the front set as 0 degrees Theta, the right as the +x direction, and the front as the +y direction. Theta increases when turning in the clockwise direction. The robot first turns to face the point it is travelling to, and then travels to that point.

    Author:
    Raymond Yang, Erica De Petrillo

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        Controls the robot to travel to the coordinate (x,y) with the robot's initial starting location as the origin. This is done by retrieving current position data of the robot and calculating the new heading the robot needs to have, as well as the distance the robot needs to travel to reach its next destination. A minimum angle approach is taken, meaning that the robot will turn the smallest angle possible to adjust its heading.

        There is a logic implemented in this method to determine the angle the robot needs to turn, clockwise, to reach its new heading. This logic is necessary largely due to the values returned by arctan function. The arctan function only returns values ranging from -pi/2 to pi/2, and real values can be + or - pi from the returned value.

        Parameters:
        x - - the x coordinate with the robot as the origin (0,0)
        y - - the y coordinate with the robot as the origin (0,0)

      • navigateTo

        public void navigateTo(double cur_x,
                       double cur_y,
                       double final_x,
                       double final_y)

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double Theta)
        Turns the robot at a fixed position to face the next destination, changes the robot heading. The minimum angle is calculated by determining whether the clockwise angle Theta is greater than half of a full circles
        Parameters:
        Theta - - the clockwise angle to turn from Theta = 0

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Wrapper method to determine whether robot is currently navigating by checking class variable isNavigating
        Returns:
        true if another thread has called travelTo() or turnTo() and the method has yet to return, false otherwise

      • locaAtTunnel

        public void locaAtTunnel(double x,
                         double y)

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                  double distance)
        This is a static method allows the conversion of a distance to the total rotation of each wheel need to cover that distance. (Distance / Wheel Circumference) = Number of wheel rotations. Number of rotations * 360.0 degrees = Total number of degrees needed to turn.
        Parameters:
        radius - - Radius of the wheel
        distance - - Distance of path
        Returns:
        an integer indicating the total rotation angle for wheel to cover the distance

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double radius,
                               double width,
                               double angle)
        This is a static method that converts the angle needed to turn at a corner to the equivalent total rotation. This method first converts the degrees of rotation, radius of wheels, and width of robot to distance needed to cover by the wheel, then the method calls another static method in process to convert distance to the number of degrees of rotation.
        Parameters:
        radius - - the radius of the wheels
        width - - the track of the robot
        angle - - the angle for the turn
        Returns:
        an int indicating the total rotation sufficient for wheel to cover turn angle
